info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 10:51PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Blaine, eastern Hill and northeastern Chouteau Counties through 1145 PM MDT... At 1048 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 15 miles northwest of Beaver Creek, or 20 miles northwest of Havre, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 57 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Havre, Chinook, Harlem, Azure, Parker School, Beaver Creek, Agency, Sangrey, Boneau, Fort Belknap, St. Pierre, Rocky Boy, Lohman, Cleveland, Zurich, Laredo, Lloyd, Kremlin and Hogeland. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
